intro: Tragia angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf tragia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas, particularly in countries like Mexico and Central America. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically yellow or greenish-yellow, with five petals and a distinctive central column. Tragia angustifolia is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including roadsides and open woodlands.
